com.samsung.spensdk

Class SCanvasView

  • java.lang.Object
    • CanvasView
      • com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.CanvasViewWrapper
        • com.samsung.spensdk.SCanvasView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapper, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperCanvas, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperDraw, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperEvent, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperObject, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperSetting, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperSignature, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperUI, com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.IViewWrapperVideo

    public class SCanvasView
extends com.samsung.spen.manager.drawwrapper.CanvasViewWrapper
    A view class to perform canvas operations using the user's finger or the S Pen's touch information.
    Inheriting from CanvasView, the SCanvasView library that provides not only note-taking functionality, but also data compatibility and animation features for multimedia objects.
    It allows you to internally load and save multimedia object information as an image file using SAMM Library, and provides for playing animations.

    - SAMM library class:
    The Samsung applications data compatible library that allows you to encode and decode multimedia object data, such as text, stamps/icons/photos, voice recordings, and note-taking strokes, and supports animation for file formats such as JPEG and PNG, all without any loss of data.
    (This library is based on the Animation Message Service (AMS).)
    Since:
    S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • addedByResizingContainer

        public boolean addedByResizingContainer(ViewGroup parentViewGroup)
        Adds an SCanvasView to a parentViewGroup by a Resizing Container.
        First, add SCanvasView to the Resizing Container, then add the Resizing Container to the parentViewGroup.
        This is useful when you set the activity property of android:windowSoftInputMode=\""adjustResize\"" in AndroidManifest.xml.
        Parameters:
        parentViewGroup - The parent layout that the Resizing Container will be added to
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3

        It must be called when exiting an application (OnDestroy).
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • isSAMMFile

        public static boolean isSAMMFile(java.lang.String sCheckFilePath)
        Gets whether or not the file is in the SAMM format.
        It checks whether or not the file is an image file that contains SAMM data.
        You can extract data from an image file with built-in internal data.
        Parameters:
        sCheckFilePath - The path to the file to check to see whether or not it is SAMM format
        Returns:
        Whether or not the file is SAMM format
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • loadSAMMData

        public boolean loadSAMMData(java.lang.String sDataKey)
        Loads SAMM data (file) using data key values.
        This lets you load SAMM data quickly when switching activities, such as for a preview.
        Extracts the note-taking data from an image file and updates it on the screen.
        If saveSAMMData() is called in different S-Canvas, same temporary directory path must be set by using setTempDirPath(String dirPath).
        Parameters:
        sDataKey - DataKey Value
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • loadSAMMData

        public boolean loadSAMMData(java.lang.String sDataKey,
                   boolean bUpdateClearImage)
        A SAMM data (file) loading method that uses data key values. Loads the temporarily saved SAMM data file using the DataKey Value returned from saveSAMMData.
        This loads the SAMM data quickly when changing activities, such as for a preview.
        Extracts writing data saved in an image file and updates it on the screen.
        If saveSAMMData() is called in different S-Canvas, same temporary directory path must be set by using setTempDirPath(String dirPath).
        Parameters:
        sDataKey - DataKey Value
        bUpdateClearImage - Whether or not to update the clear image when updating the screen.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • loadSAMMFile

        public boolean loadSAMMFile(java.lang.String sSAMMFilePath,
                   boolean bDrawObject,
                   boolean bThreadLoading,
                   boolean bShowProgressDialog)
        Loads the SAMM data image file.
        Extracts the note-taking data from an image file and updates it on the screen.
        Since the file can take some time to load, you can set ThreadLoading and bShowProgressDialog to true so that the progress dialog box is shown to indicate the loading process.
        Set bThreadLoading to false to not show the progress dialog box.
        The progress dialog box is set in the setProgressDialogSetting method.
        Parameters:
        sSAMMFilePath - The filename to load
        bDrawObject - Whether or not to draw the loaded object.
        bThreadLoading - Whether or not to load the file in a thread
        bShowProgressDialog - Whether or not to show the progress dialog box when loading teh file
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • loadSAMMFileExcludeObjectData

        @Deprecated
public boolean loadSAMMFileExcludeObjectData(java.lang.String sSAMMFilePath)
        Deprecated. 
        Loads the SAMM data image file.
        Instead of object data, the foreground image is extracted from the file and the screen is updated with it.
        If there is no foreground image loaded, it will perform the same as loadSAMMFile (sSAMMFilePath, true).
        Parameters:
        sSAMMFilePath - The name of a file to load
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • saveSAMMFile

        public boolean saveSAMMFile(java.lang.String sSAMMFilePath)
        Saves the SAMM data image file.
        Saves the writing screen as an image file with a designated filename, and obtains data created in the canvas and encodes it in a file path.
        In order to check the data compatibility between applications, the application ID for the SAMM file must be delivered at the same time.
        If the filename has no extension, PNG is selected automatically. If an unsupported extension is entered, PNG is also selected automatically.
        Parameters:
        sSAMMFilePath - A SAMMData filename. PNGand JPG are supported for saving images, and AMS for saving data only.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • saveSAMMData

        public java.lang.String saveSAMMData()
        Saves the temporary SAMM data file for previewing.
        Saves SAMM data to the path created in the library.
        This lets you save SAMM data quickly when switching activities, such as for a preview.
        The cached SAMMData is loaded from the SAMMData save path extracted using the DataKey value returned from saveSAMMData.
        Returns:
        A DataKey String. This is the value created in the library.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • encodeSAMMDataInFile

        public boolean encodeSAMMDataInFile(java.lang.String sExistFilePath)
        Encodes SAMM data in a file. (Adds the SAMM data to an existing file.)
        If the file already contains SAMM data, overwrite the data.
        In order to check the data compatibility between applications, the application ID for the SAMM file must be given at the same time.
        Parameters:
        sExistFilePath - The name of the file to encode SAMM data in
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • removeSAMMDataFromFile

        public static boolean removeSAMMDataFromFile(java.lang.String sExistSAMMFilePath)
        Removes SAMM data encoded in a file. (Removes the SAMM file format.)
        Returns False if no SAMM data is encoded in the file.
        Parameters:
        sExistSAMMFilePath - JPG and PNG are supported.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

        - SCanvasConstants.SCANVAS_SETTINGVIEW_SIZE_EXT and SCanvasConstants.SCANVAS_SETTINGVIEW_SIZE_MEDIUM are available only in the Pen Settings, and SCanvasConstants.SCANVAS_SETTINGVIEW_SIZE_NORMAL is selected for other settings.

      • setSettingStrokeInfo

        public boolean setSettingStrokeInfo(int sammStrokeStyle,
                           float sammStrokeWidth,
                           int sammStrokeColor)
        Sets the properties of the current stroke to the specified values.
        Parameters:
        sammStrokeStyle - The stroke style (SObjectStroke.SAMM_STROKE_STYLE_PENCIL, SObjectStroke.SAMM_STROKE_STYLE_MARKER, etc.)
        If SObjectStroke.SAMM_STROKE_STYLE_BEAUTIFY is set as the sammStrokeStyle, return false. Because beautify pen needs more parameters to be set.
        sammStrokeWidth - The stroke width
        If inserted sammStrokeWidth is not valid value, the width is set as following.
        If the stroke style is SAMM_STROKE_STYLE_ERASER, the range of the stroke width is SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MAX_ERASERSIZE,
        otherwise, SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MIN_STROKESIZE <= strokeWidth <= SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MAX_STROKESIZE
        sammStrokeColor - The stroke color
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • setEraserStrokeSetting

        public boolean setEraserStrokeSetting(int nEraserWidth)
        Sets the pen as an eraser that allows you to draw transparently.
        Available in both animation mode and edit mode.
        Parameters:
        nEraserWidth - The eraser size
        If inserted nEraserWidth is not valid value, set as 1(when nEraserWidth less than 1) or SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MAX_ERASERSIZE(when nEraserWidth more than SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MAX_ERASERSIZE).
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • setEraserPenSetting

        @Deprecated
public boolean setEraserPenSetting(int nEraserWidth)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the pen as an eraser that allows you to draw transparently.
        Available in both animation mode and edit mode.
        Use setEraserStrokeSetting() instead.
        Parameters:
        nEraserWidth - The eraser size
        If "nEraserWidth" is not valid value, set as 1("nEraserWidth" is less than 1) or SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MAX_ERASERSIZE(nEraserWidth is more than SObjectStroke.SAMM_DEFAULT_MAX_ERASERSIZE).
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:

      • setSettingTextInfo

        public boolean setSettingTextInfo(int sammTextStyle,
                         float sammTextWidth,
                         int sammTextColor,
                         java.lang.String fontName)
        Sets the properties of the current text to the specified values.
        Parameters:
        sammTextStyle - Text style. The style can be combination of following values. (SObjectText.SAMM_TEXT_STYLE_BOLD, SObjectText.SAMM_TEXT_STYLE_ITALIC, SObjectText.SAMM_TEXT_STYLE_UNDERLINE)
        If inserted sammTextStyle is not defined Text type, set SObjectText.SAMM_TEXT_STYLE_NONE.
        sammTextWidth - Text size
        sammTextColor - Text color
        If the alpha value of sammTextColor is not 255, set 255 as alpha of sammTextColor.
        fontName - Text font name
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • setCanvasZoomScale

        public boolean setCanvasZoomScale(float fScale,
                         boolean bHideScrollbar)
        Zooms in on an SCanvasView.
        The greater the parameter value, the bigger the zoom.
        For instance, if the scale parameter is 2.5, the basic SCanvasView is zoomed by 2.5 times.
        Parameters:
        fScale - Absolute zoom values: 1 ~ 50, 1 is the original size.
        bHideScrollbar - The option whether or not to hide the canvas scrollbar
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • setCanvasZoomScale

        public boolean setCanvasZoomScale(float fScale,
                         float cx,
                         float cy,
                         boolean bHideScrollbar)
        Zooms in on an SCanvasView.
        The greater the scale value, the bigger the zoom.
        For instance, if the scale parameter is 2.5, the basic SCanvasView is zoomed by 2.5 times.
        Parameters:
        fScale - Absolute zoom values: 1 ~ 50, 1 is the original size.
        cx - The X coordinate to mark the center of the SCanvasView
        cy - The Y coordinate to mark the center of the SCanvasView
        bHideScrollbar - The option whether or not to hide the canvas scrollbar
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • getCanvasZoomScale

        public float getCanvasZoomScale()
        Returns the value of the current zoom ratio.
        Returns:
        Relative zoom values: 1 ~ 50, a ratio set by setBaseScale(float).
        In other words getCanvasZoomScale() is not affected by setZoomBaseScale(float), but by setCanvasZoomScale(float) and setCanvasZoomScale(float, float, float).
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • setCanvasBaseZoomScale

        public boolean setCanvasBaseZoomScale(float fBaseScale)
        Sets the default zoom ratio to other than x1.
        Setting this value can affect the magnification of zoom functions.
        For example, For instance, if you set the default zoom ratio to x2 and select x2.5 setCanvasZoomScale,
        the screen is zoomed in by 2 x 2.5 = 5.
        Parameters:
        fBaseScale - The default zoom ratio
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • panBySCanvas

        public boolean panBySCanvas(float dx,
                   float dy,
                   boolean bHideScrollbar)
        Moves an SCanvasView by X and Y.
        Enter X and Y values to move the SCanvasView a distance equal to the values.
        The distance is not affected by the zoom status; that is, when moving the view 1 pixel on the X axis while in the x2 zoom mode,
        the screen moves only 1 pixel not 2.
        Parameters:
        dx - A distance to move on the X axis
        dy - A distance to move on the Y axis
        bHideScrollbar - The option whether or not to hide the canvas scrollbar
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • panToSCanvas

      • isCanvasDrawingEmpty

        public boolean isCanvasDrawingEmpty(boolean bOnlyConsiderForeground)
        Gets whether or not the canvas is empty.
        A canvas may look empty even when there are objects in it because a stroke may not be seen by the eraser object.
        This method checks whether or not the canvas looks empty by checking its pixel intensity.

      • setClearImageBitmap

        public boolean setClearImageBitmap(Bitmap clearImageBitmap)
        Sets the initial foreground image bitmap of the canvas.
        When the user clears the canvas by clearScreen() method, all of the contents are cleared then this foreground image(clearImageBitmap) is shown finally.
        Undo is not supported.
        The bitmap(clearImageBitmap) can be removed by eraser. It is diffent with the background image.
        (Backgrond image can not be removed by eraser).
        This image can be used for eraser animation effects such as "defrost animation".)
        It is better to use a bitmap with the same size as the canvas.
        If it is a different size, the setClearImageBitmap method resizes the bitmap to fill the canvas.
        To delete the initial foreground image, call setClearImageBitmap(null).
        Parameters:
        clearImageBitmap - The initial foreground image bitmap of the canvas. Passing null removes the defined initial foreground image.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • getClearImageBitmap

        public Bitmap getClearImageBitmap()
        Gets the initial foreground image buffer of the canvas.
        Returns:
        The initial foreground image bitmap of the canvas
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • setClearImageBitmap

        public boolean setClearImageBitmap(Bitmap clearBitmap,
                          int nImageFilterOption,
                          int nFilterLevel)
        Sets the initial foreground image bitmap of the canvas.
        When the user clears the canvas by clearScreen() method, all of the contents are cleared then this foreground image(clearImageBitmap) is shown finally.
        The bitmap(clearImageBitmap) can be removed by eraser. It is diffent with the background image.
        (Backgrond image can not be removed by eraser).
        This image can be used for eraser animation effects such as "defrost animation".)
        It is better to use a bitmap with the same size as the canvas.
        If it is a different size, the setClearImageBitmap method resizes the bitmap to fill the canvas.
        To delete the initial foreground image, call setClearImageBitmap(null).
        Parameters:
        clearBitmap - The initial foreground image bitmap. The initial clear image bitmap, or original image.
        nImageFilterOption - Image filter to be applied for the original image : FILTER_GRAY, FILTER_BLUR, FILTER_MOSAIC, etc. The kind of image filter defined at SPenImageFilterConstants
        nFilterLevel - The level of the image effect to use: FILTER_LEVEL_VERYSMALL, FILTER_LEVEL_SMALL, FILTER_LEVEL_MEDIUM, FILTER_LEVEL_LARGE, FILTER_LEVEL_VERYLARGE)
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • clearSCanvasView

        public boolean clearSCanvasView()
        Deletes the entire image drawn on a canvas as well as any associated data/title/background/attached data, such as background audio and background text. Undo is not supported.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • clearScreen

        public boolean clearScreen()
        Clears the canvas screen. (Operates the same as clearScreen(true).) In this case, it is reset with the initial clear image if there is any initial clear image for the canvas configured with the setClearImageBitmap() method, but none of the actions can be undone. If there is no initial clear image for the canvas, the screen is cleared and all actions can be undone. (Supported only for drawing data.) For reference, if it is set as setClearImageBitmap(null), the initial clear image is removed.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • clearScreen

        public boolean clearScreen(boolean bUndoable)
        Clears the canvas screen. In this case, if there is an initial clear image for the canvas configured with the setClearImageBitmap() method, it is reset with the initial clear image, and no actions can be undone. If there is no initial clear image of the canvas configured, the screen is cleared and all actions can be undone. (Supported only for drawing data and bUndoable must be set to true.) For reference, if it is set as setClearImageBitmap(null), the initial clear image is removed.
        Parameters:
        bUndoable - Whether undo can be performed
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.2

      • setBlockingMode

        public void setBlockingMode(boolean bBlockingMode)
        Sets blocking mode.
        If blocking mode is set, then the processing speed may be slower because the next process must wait until the previous process is completed before it starts.
        Blocking mode can sometimes deliver greater stability.
        Default set is false.
        Parameters:
        bBlockingMode - Whether or not blocking mode is on
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3

      • setAnimationMode

        public boolean setAnimationMode(boolean bAnimationMode)
        Sets the animation mode.
        Once the animation mode has been set, it is impossible to draw on the screen by touching it.
        It is not permitted to change the mode after initializing a activity.
        Parameters:
        bAnimationMode - Whether or not to use animation mode
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • isAnimationMode

        public boolean isAnimationMode()
        Gets whether or not it is in animation mode.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the canvas is in animation mode
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • getAnimationState

        public int getAnimationState()
        Gets the current animation state.
        Returns:
        The current animation state
        - SAMMLibConstants.ANIMATION_STATE_OFF_ANIMATION (Not in animation mode)
        - SAMMLibConstants.ANIMATION_STATE_ON_STOP (Animation stopped)
        - SAMMLibConstants.ANIMATION_STATE_ON_PAUSED (Animation paused)
        - SAMMLibConstants.ANIMATION_STATE_ON_RUNNING (Animation running)
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • setAnimationSpeed

        public boolean setAnimationSpeed(int nSpeed)
        Sets the animation speed to the specified option.
        Parameters:
        nSpeed - The animation speed option
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_SLOW (Slow animation speed)
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_NORMAL (Normal animation speed)
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_FASTS (Fast animation speed)
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_AUTO (Automatic animation speed)
        By default, SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_AUTO (Automatic animation speed)
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • getAnimationSpeed

        public int getAnimationSpeed()
        Gets the animation speed.
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_SLOW (Slow animation speed)
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_NORMAL (Normal animation speed)
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_FASTS (Fast animation speed)
        - SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_AUTO (Automatic animation speed)
        - By default, SOptionPlay.ANIMATION_SPEED_AUTO (Automatic animation speed)
        Returns:
        The current animation speed
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • setAppID

        public boolean setAppID(java.lang.String appIDName,
               int appIDVersionMajor,
               int appIDVersionMinor,
               java.lang.String appIDVerPatchName)
        Sets the Application ID.
        The Application ID is a string of the form: [App Name] [Major Version].[Minor Version] [PatchName] For example, "AMS 1.12".
        The Application ID is used to manage data according for different versions of the same application, or to exchange data between heterogeneous applications.
        You must define the Application ID when saving a SAMM file.
        Parameters:
        appIDName - Application ID Name
        appIDVersionMajor - Application ID Major Version
        appIDVersionMinor - Application ID Minor Version
        appIDVerPatchName - Application ID Patch Version Name
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • setCustomBGImageIndex

        public boolean setCustomBGImageIndex(int nBGIndex)
        Specifies the user-defined background image index.
        It is not necessary to save the background image when saving or loading SAMM data. However, it is best to display the corresponding background image by referring to an index value.
        This method defines a custom application background image index, and therefore, data is not compatible between heterogeneous applications.
        Parameters:
        nBGIndex - The user-defined background image index.
        This is the image index referred to when indexing an applications native background image list.
        It supports a range of 0 ~ 155 (156 in total). If a value outside the range is entered, it returns false.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • getCustomBGImageIndex

        public int getCustomBGImageIndex()
        Gets the user-defined background image index.
        It is not necessary to save the background image when saving or loading SAMM data. However, it is best to display the corresponding background image by referring to an index value.
        This method defines a custom application background image index, and therefore, data is not compatible between heterogeneous applications.
        Returns:
        The user-defined background image index
        It supports a range of 0 ~ 155 (156 in total). If the background image style is not indexed, or if it is outside the user background image index range, or an error occurs, it returns -1.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • setCustomBGAudioIndex

        public boolean setCustomBGAudioIndex(int nIndex)
        Specifies a user-defined background audio index.
        Set the index to correspond to a built-in audio file when providing the applications native background audio.
        Use a preset index to play the background audio when in animation mode.
        This method defines a custom appliction background audio index, and therefore, data is not compatible between heterogeneous applications.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The user-defined background audio index.
        The audio index is referred to when indexing an applications native background audio list.
        It supports a range of 0 ~ 155 (156 in total). Returns false if a value outside the range is entered.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • getCustomBGAudioIndex

        public int getCustomBGAudioIndex()
        Gets the user-defined background audio index.
        Gets the index corresponding to the built-in audio file when providing the applications native background audio.
        This method defines a custom appliction background image index, and therefore, data is not compatible between heterogeneous applications.
        Returns:
        The user-defined background audio index.
        It supports a range of 0 ~ 155 (156 in total). If the background audio style is not indexed, or it is outside the user background audio index range, or an error occurs, it returns -1.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • setBGAudioAsRecordedVoice

        public boolean setBGAudioAsRecordedVoice()
        Sets audio data recorded in the library as the background audio.
        You must start recording with the recordVoiceStart method and end with the recordVoiceComplete method before calling setBGAudioAsRecordedVoice.
        Methods for voice recording in the library are: startVoiceRecording, cancelVoiceRecording, completeVoiceRecording.
        Voice recordings are saved as 3GP files.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • attachFile

        public boolean attachFile(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.String fileDescription,
                 Bitmap thumbnail,
                 int pageIndex)
        Adds attachments. You can save up to 20 attachments.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The attachment file path (full path including filename)
        fileDescription - The string describing the attachments
        thumbnail - The thumbnail icon image indicating the attachments.
        pageIndex - The page Index to attach file (not supported) If the thumbnail icon image is large, it is saved after being internally reduced to a thumbnail.
        It does not matter if the thumbnail icon image is null, depending on the purpose of the application, but it is better to set it as a bitmap for compatibility.
        You can set it as an application icon interlocking with files using the setFileIcon(packageName) method of the SDataAttachFile class.
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • getSAMMObject

        public final SObject getSAMMObject(int nObjectIndex)
        Gets the information of SAMM objects from Total ObjectList including both visible and invisible. Since SAMMObject return an SObject instance, and the actual object, which inherits from SObject, is derived class, such as an SObjectStroke or SObjectImage, you must first determine the actual class for the SObject instance using "instanceof" before you can type-cast and use it.
        Parameters:
        nObjectIndex - The SAMM object index
        Returns:
        The SAMM object of nObjectIndex
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.0

      • getSAMMObject

        public final SObject getSAMMObject(int nObjectIndex,
                    boolean bOnlyIncludeVisible)
        Gets the information of SAMM objects from Total ObjectList including both visible and invisible. Since the returned SAMMObject is an instance of the actual object class that has been inherited from SObject, such as SObjectStroke, SObjectImage, etc., you should determine the instance of which class it is with "instanceof" before you can use it by type-casting with the actual object information.
        Parameters:
        nObjectIndex - The SAMM object index
        bOnlyIncludeVisible - whether including only visible object or not
        Returns:
        The SAMM object
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • setSingleSelectionFixedLayerMode

        public void setSingleSelectionFixedLayerMode(boolean bSingleSelectionFixedLayerMode)
        Sets the canvas mode to maintain canvas compatibility with SPen SDK 2.2 (including 2.2.5).
        By adding support for object depth changes, object multi-selection and grouping in SPen SDK 2.3, the concept for the canvas changed.
        This mode is maintains compatibility with the canvas in SPen SDK 2.2 (including 2.2.5).
        If this mode is set, only a single selection of image and text is allowed, and object grouping and depth changes are not supported.
        The z-order of the Text/Image object is always under the stroke object.
        Parameters:
        bSingleSelectionFixedLayerMode - Whether to maintain canvas compatibility with SPen SDK 2.2.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3

      • getSingleSelectionFixedLayerMode

        public boolean getSingleSelectionFixedLayerMode()
        Gets whether to maintain canvas compatibility with SPen SDK 2.2 (including 2.2.5) ver.
        Returns:
        Whether to maintain canvas compatibility with SPen SDK 2.2 ver.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3

      • showSAMMVideoView

        public boolean showSAMMVideoView(SObjectVideo sObjectVideo)
        Creates a VideoView for an SObjectVideo whose style is set to SObjectVideo.SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL.
        If the SObjectVideo style is SObjectVideo.SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_URL, it launches the associated video app.
        Set the area (setRect() in SObjectVideo) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        sObjectVideo - The SObjectVideo data to insert
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3

      • changeSAMMObject

        public boolean changeSAMMObject(int nObjectIdx,
                       SObject newSObjectToChange)
        Changes the SAMM object.
        Some attributes of the SObject can not be changed.
        Only rect and angle can be changed for SObjectStroke.
        Only rect and angle can be changed for SObjectImage.
        Only rect and text string can be changed for SObjectText. And the size of changed rect can be different with that of newSObjectToChange, because rect size is dependent for text string.
        Only rect and angle can be changed for SObjectFilling.
        Only rect is changable for SObjectVideo.
        Only rect is changable for SObjectGroup.
        Parameters:
        nObjectIdx - The SObjectIndex to change
        newSObjectToChange - The new SObject data to change. *
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1

      • updateSAMMObjectList

        public boolean updateSAMMObjectList(java.util.LinkedList<SObject> sObjectList,
                           boolean bTransaction)
        Updates each of the attributes in the SObject list.

        If false, undo and redo operations are done for each object.

      • registerSignature

        public int registerSignature()
        Registers the signature.
        Returns:
        The order of the registered signature tells you if the call was successful.
        If the text is too small, or if it is different from a previously registered signature, -1 is returned.
        If registration is successful, the registered order(1 ~ 3) is returned.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.1
